questions.question_text: Which one of the following lists the five quality criteria for defining Architecture Principles?

choices.B: Comprehensive, Future proof, Short, Concise, Consistent

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The key purpose of Gap Analysis is to _____ ActualTests.com

choices.E: determine the required service levels for the architecture
choices.B: identify potential missing or overlapping functions
choices.D: identify commercial building blocks to be purchased
choices.A: establish quality parameters for the architecture

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The technique known as gap analysis is widely used in the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM) to validate an architecture that is being developed. The basic premise is to highlight a shortfall between the Baseline Architecture and the Target Architecture; that is, items that have been deliberately omitted, accidentally left out, or not yet defined.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap27.html

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. TOGAF 9 Part III provides a set of resources that can be used to adapt and modify the ____________.

discussion.content: PART III is ADM Guidelines & Techniques which contains a collection of guidelines and techniques available for use in applying the TOGAF approach and the TOGAF ADM. Additional guidelines and techniques are available in the TOGAF Library.

Selected Answer: B
17. Introduction to Part III (ADM Guidelines and Techniques)
17.1 Guidelines for Adapting the ADM Process
The Architecture Development Method (ADM) process can be adapted to deal with a number of different usage scenarios, including different process styles (e.g., the use of iteration) and also specific specialist architectures (such as security).

Selected Answer: B
Part III: ADM Guidelines and Techniques

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/m/pt3.html

Selected Answer: B
B. Architecture Development Method

questions.question_text: Which phase of the ADM focuses on the governance and management of the Architecture Con-tracts that cover the overall implementation and deployment process?
